comments.body: Yes just like the Villagers have a Zombie Villager skin
Good for diversity, I like it. 50% is the best way I think.
I want to see it.
Yes, this should definitely be the case. Having just Steve zombies by default has seemed odd since Alex was introduced.
This makes so logical sense! I don't understand why it's not under review.
Of course we can't forget that "Alex?" Zombies need to have 3 pixel wide arms. Also maybe the long amount of hair they have has rotted to a silver gray or pitch black?
Simple addition, should be very easy to implement, you have my support!
This could also be for husks and drowned
Good idea, they could also include their versions of husk and drowned
And for husks also
Zombie Alex could be like that : (I made this picture)

Since the current zombie sounds are very similar to Steveâ€™s old damage sounds, it would make some sense to have these Alex zombies make slightly more feminine sounds, at least in my opinion.
Anyways, this is something I would LOVE to see in game. You have my support!
I think it fits wonderfully
Yeah, i think that it could be a nice update to zombies
This was my idea as well

Also make Steve and Alex zombies able to breed using raw meat.

TangentPuppy60 that with slim model would be better

lordcoolcookie good idea

PurpleArtist good idea

b/c Alex is slimmer (less heavy) she should be slightly faster
then we should also include drowned and husks alex

It would add necessary variation and diversity, just make the game look aesthetically better in a very subtle but noticeable way. Also I always kind of liked the Alex skin better then the Steve skin just in general.
Yes please! Alex zombies, husks would be cool.
No green hair!
Maybe zombies alex are a good idea
I was about to post the same!, indeed it should be like this.
Makes sense to me.
Now that the game has many more default skins, it would be cool if there are zombie textures for all these skins!

The Alex zombie would be just like a normal zombie. But if she picks-up bow, she could use it. It would be extremely rare to find one that spawns with a bow.

An Alex Drown version could be included too. If she spawns with a trident, there would be a 100% chance of dropping the trident and it would have zero damage. The Alex Drown would also have a fish tail instead of legs, like a siren.
It'd be neat if crows would try to eat crops and you could use armor stands as scarecrows! Also, since crows are scavengers, they should attack Zombies. Vultures could be desert variants of crows.

And if these were added, I'd totally just turn all my farms into greenhouses xP

 

I love the idea that they would circle over treasure, since crows love shiny things and would hope that you would leave some trinkets behind for them when you uncover them.
YES I love crows!!!!!
I like crows, but not for taming. They should be a pest like Nox said, destroying crops and requiring scarecrows to fend them away from your crops.
I agree. These pests might take dropped shiny things, and occasionally spawn as a witches pet. Like wolves, they will protect their owner. Except, they will not be tameable for players.
If you tame them they should steal mobs items
i think you should be able to breed them with meat
Also crows could alert you if mobs were coming.
Good idea I love animals so yeah.
Crows should like bread if you feed them ever day after five days they will bring a gold nugget or and emerald when you feed them also they hang around villages
It would be cool if once tamed they would bring you random items, with it usually being simple stuff like string and a flower but very rarely bringing you gold or diamond or something!

Also, if one is attacked, they could attack you in groups (like zombified piglings), but the one attacked would attack you forever (until you get away, die, or kill it)
It has lots of possibilities!
Maybe there could be a system where, the more crows you attack, the more hostile they become, and if you feed them, they could come close to the area you fed them
yes, i also think you should be able to befriend them with shiny objects as crows are know to be smart and remember kind acts. They should be able to (once tamed) bring gifts for the player.
They should take iron tools and iron because irl they steal shiny stuff.
Realistically, crows have 360 vision so sneaking up from behind wouldn't make a difference. Still a cool idea though

If we were to base them off real life crows, then they can be friends with the player if you feed them. Although, I think it should be more like cats where they're cautious around the player and fly away from them unless you have the desired food item (could be seeds or meat since they're omnivores). I also think when it comes to feeding them, it should be like dolphins where they can't be tamed, but can bring you to treasure chests or something like that.

For hostility, it should be like what another commenter said where they'll attack as a group if one of them gets hit by the player.

Lastly, I agree with another commenter where they should pick off at your crops and scarecrows (aka armor stands) should deter them. I think maybe when you befriend the crows by feeding them, they won't eat your crops. The more you feed them, the less likely they'll eat your crops (5 times max maybe?).
Post is mostly about Ice Giant mob, moving accordingly.
About how tall would it be?
Yeah we need this boss fight in Minecraft this is insanely good
WIAT WAIT..... LIKE FROST GIANTS IN NORSE MYTHOLOGY
Maybe YETI
I like this idea, but I think the Ice Giant is a little to OP.
Yeah some mobs needs some animation like sleeping so it will be awesome!!!!!
Foxes can rest under trees, so they and all animals should sleep at night! They could use the foxes animation, and or the catâ€™s animation!

I agree, there should absolutely be a day/ night cycle for the mobs

This would add more immersion !

and now that we see Foxes sleeping i think we could have, for most mobs, sleeping behavours
Great idea!
I think with the new foxes and bees sleeping, this trend should be added to old mobs as well.
Great idea!
Yes this would make sense.   I mean foxes and bats have resting animation so why don't other mobs?
Great idea ðŸ’¡

I was just talking about this with someone!!! It would add so much more to Minecraft and it would definitely be worth implementing. It's such a small change but it makes such a big difference in the Minecraft experience! Just think about all the animals sleeping at night... IT WOULD BE ADORABLE.

I agree. Animals (sheep, pigs, cows, cats, dogs/wolves, foxes, birds) should sleep at night. If there is a mob near-by or they are attacked by a player they wake up and run away. Cats should spend a lot of time sleeping, during both the day and the night, but wake up if the player is holding a fish.
To make baby animals grows while sleeping in night
Animating the animal torso to expand/contract when sleeping to mimic breathing would also be awesome.

Horses should sleep too. During the night, they will lay down, but sometimes during the day, they will stand and put their heads halfway down and hold it there, so as to imitate sleep. They should also close their eyes. Animals should also have an energy bar. If the bar gets low, they sleep. Then, if the bar is full, they will run around, and when it is empty, they will walk slowly, and fall asleep often.

I was thinking about this the other day and I agree.

You could even add in a gameplay element! For example - animals that are given shelter and regular sleep will yield more resources and/or animals that arne't given sleep will avoid the player or provide less resources.

This would definitely make things more believable and immersive.
Yes! Mojang please add this. This would be awesome it'll make the mobs feel more alive.
It would be nice if sheep slept. The baa's at night are a lot.
I think that if you make an end crystal and surround it by clocks you can go back in time

Maybe a time core which you can make by a end crystal being surrounded by blocks of time They will be blank completely white and blank and it will be like a cage which is blocked on the bottom And it will have a hole on each side So the end crystal will turn green when you stand in it it will transport you into the Dinosaur world.
This would make sence we have flying undead birds (Phantoms) Giant Mad Horned Pigs (Hoglin) and Golems made out of a Crystal (Iron Golem) -ECT-
If you mean that the time machine is a portal craftable through fossils and that with fociles you can revive dinosaurs through eggs? Sounds good for a future update, but nothing high-tech.

I love dinosaurs

do you
This is a good idea!
the dinasur live in the savannat like the velociractor the jurassic park two

This is a TERRIBLE idea. If you want this, make a mod of it. It would completely ruin Minecraft and have something too modern. Minecraft is about fantasy and medieval stuff. This would not really fit the game...at allm
In creative mode we would like to be able to spawn dinosaurs
What if there were some way to resurrect a fossil into a dinosaur? I would definitely vote for that
It needs to be a portal to a dinosaur dimension not a time machine
You should be able to ride Dinosaurs and have them help you in battles
I like dinosaurs, it can be a good idea to a future version.
That means we can make Jurassic park
That means we can make Jurassic park

Or you could make a machine/portal that takes you to the dinosaur age (maybe make the sniffers dig something up that you need to make the portal or just involve the sniffers in some way) and you can bring the dinosaurs to the present similar to how you bring a ghast from the nether to the overworld and maybe you can make a different version of the portal that takes you to the future now that would be fun and bring people back to the game.
Nah u would be cooked

Why dont we get dino fossils from the soul sand biome? I mean, we find a bone structure, but with ancient-bones *new block ideas* & in the middle, can be a egg, that could be hatched with a campfire nearby

the smartest animal are humans....
Humans aren't animals...
This is actually a REALLY good thing I would love to train my dog.
But humans are animals.
also, great idea! I'd love to see this implemented
I love this idea, but it would need to be simpler.
Cats are in the corner laughing.
I'd like to be able to get dogs and cats to patrol an area, like a farm, and not just be limited to the choice of having them sit around doing nothing or following me around constantly.
I love this idea, this should have more votes.

Hello,

 

This is Mark Abernathy.  Creator of the post.  I'm not able to log into my original account for the time being.

 

I wanted to point out that the mechanic introduced with Bees could be a blue print for my idea here.  The bees remember the coordinates of flowers and return there after dropping off honey.  Its a small part of my idea, but an important one.
This sounds very modded to me, but would give dogs a much needed use, after they have been neglected for so long.

The dolphins would particularly hate this idea, due to events like those at Sea World, leading to it shutting down if I remember correctly. That said, dolphins in nature will bully others with different patterns and some will intentionally poison themselves with pufferfish, so they might not be better off in their own "society." Dolphins are also smart enough to take advantage of the system. (for example they were paid in fish to retrieve trash from a pool, so they would trap the trash under a rock and tear it, to retrieve fish at their leisure without actually accomplishing anything.)

Great idea- i think the training block idea is flawed, however. Maybe the possibility of a whole menu for dogs- you have to use experience to train the dog? Maybe a right click opens a menu? Maybe its like the enchanting table where it will take a certain amount of experience and then you can train the dog into different categories.

Protection Training- you can train the dog to protect you from harm, or another player, or something else by entering it's menu and changing settings.

Herding Training- train the dog to herd sheep by opening said menu and telling the dog what to herd and where.

Hunting Training- the dog will hunt animals depending on what you train it to hunt.

Theres so many good ideas here. I think this definitely has a shot.
Aww it's so cute!!!

I do enjoy the dandelion fluff which could puff up when it flies/floats about. That brings more uniqueness to Minecraft and it reminds me of a certain monster in Monster Hunter World but cuter for the standards of this game.

And of course, farming these creatures could influence brewing.
Where did you make your textures?
Maybe they could spawn in different colours too.
I'll totally vote for that
I demand this be in the game
It will be fantastic with this is mob!
this is amazing i need this
I definitely agree for this little cutie to be added in! I'd just be delighted to see little Florat's floating around, and other people will too!

This is perfect for enhancing that the lush caves are an ecosystem and have life in them plus it would be perfect for farms and pets (doesnâ€™t matter if there is a taming option or not Iâ€™m gonna keep them)
Maybe the smiling animation could be different by looking more adorable but I can barely imagine it could get better in any other way I LOVE THIS IDEA.

I would love to see this in the game! It would add more cuteness, ambience and diversity to the lush caves. I think it looks really unique and it would make sense to have a herbivorous creature/rodent in the lush caves to eat some of the plants (to maintain the balance of the ecosystem). Concerning flower production, maybe a system could be implemented that would allow you to 'feed'/give the florat a certain flower and they, in turn, would produce that flower when they bloom? Tameability would also be nice/cute but of course not necessary :)
MINECRAFT NEEDS TO ADD THIS!!!

I have an idea- axolotls could attempt to eat them, but instead of dying, fully bloomed florats will make the axolotl sneeze then run away. And if the florat hasn't bloomed, other florats will aid it!
They are adorible
I love it! Such a open and creative idea!
Idk why but this makes me think of fraggles
We NEED this
First vote! Great idea! But, could you add more info, like how the fish would look like. I love the idea, though!
Lacking in fish? Please, a youtuber discovered that there are over 3,000 fish in Minecraft! But I still like the idea that deserves a vote :)

I'm new so I'm not sure if there is a way to ping people, but hopefully both commenters can see this!

@StarKittychu : They could have a few different skins--yellow, orange, red, black, grey, and white and combinations of those colors. Pretty much they could just have colors and patterns that real koi and goldfish have. Maybe have a few set patterns with the colors inside randomized similar to the tropical fish in oceans. Or just a few set skins.

@Alexandr Kulashko : I didn't mean there is no variety, there is definitely a lot of variety in oceans! But in rivers, all you seem to see is salmon which is a bit boring compared to oceans.
Thatâ€™s awesome!
:3 I like this idea!

I made this post a while ago, but thinking back on it, I would like to say that a whole new food item for converting carp to goldfish wouldn't be necessary. Pet goldfish can actually eat carrots (if cooked) so a golden carrot would do just fine.
Maybe add a lake biome where these can spawn as well?

We need carp and more freshwater fish. Domesticating fish seems neat too, but feeding them gold ingots or bars? I donno. Also golden sea grass? No thanks. Too many suggestions for a single post, hard to agree with everything.
I would like to see koi that you can pick up with a bucket
Good idea and the different types of koi and goldfish manly the butterfly koi

I am so excited for this idea! 

There are some varieties of koi that could be placed, such as, Kohaku, Sanke, Showa, Asagi, and many more. 

There are also many kinds of goldfish like, Oranda, Comets, and Wakins, that come in all different colors. These colors include calico, red and white, black and red, black and white and so on. 

It would also be awesome that when you breed them that they would have 5-10 eggs at a time that would hatch a 2 days or so, later. 

Thus would all contribute to what happens with goldfish and koi in real life.

Once again so excited if this becomes a thing in Minecraft.  ðŸ˜†

I would love to have a pond with koi just chilling. Maybe there could be a deeper mechanic for koi in the form of breeding. Perhaps in the wild you will find mostly plain koi, but if you breed ones with different colors and patterns you can get very beautiful fish like how real life breeders do to get lovely koi. And unlike the other fish in the game, koi won't run away from players because irl they tend to be pretty keen of humans.

I would like if gave a koi dragon breath it turn into a dragon koi that could help the player in some way dont know maybe drop a rare item once in awhile at random or make it the equilvent to a horse but in in idk just like the idea of koi turning into dragon you know from the legends........and zen koi 2 :>

Monkey will be perfect with 1.19 + add Banana :)

monky

it would be super cool if they threw things at the player as well. i donâ€™t think it would necessarily be a hostile feature (the player wouldnâ€™t take damage), but replicating that behavior could be really fun and add a sense of unpredictability to exploring biomes where monkeys could spawn :-)
I think monkeys would be a neat as I would love to tame one and maybe they could have something to do to with the Jungle Temples? I love the idea!
Big bananas too
Monkeys added and black Panthers
Would be so stoked if they added a monkey.

Wonderful idea. But I have two suggestions. Maybe the cows should follow the bulls instead of the bulls following the cows? Maybe it should be some sort of herding mechanic. And lastly, Hide shouldnâ€™t be as good as iron, thatâ€™s a little OP. Maybe it should be as good as chainmail or gold?
@TheFriendlyPine I love your suggestions
Hide is just another word for leather. Iâ€™m otherwise all for it!
They should also breed all the cows. In real life cows donâ€™t mate with each other so the bull should be able to breed 10 cows before it has a breeding cool down
Good mod idea, but I actually don't want it in Minecraft

I like this idea, it's a good way to create herd mechanics as well as a way for animals to defend themselves, and it's not overly complicated. I think it could also be applied to other types of animals as well. Sheep could have Ram mobs to protect them, Pigs could have Boar mobs to protect them, Roosters for Chickens, etc.

I  do like this idea but the problem is mobs are gender neutral. Bulls are Male cows. The cows in minecraft are both female and Male because they are gender neutral making the cows all bulls. If they do this they would have to make genders for all the mobs giving more work to Mojang Studios since they would have to make more mobs.
I love this especially adding the protector mob for peaceful mobs but I do find the hide mechanics op

I have one idea with your idea, when we kill a bull, we receive an Horn and a tail we can wear this, the Horn and tail scared some mobs (especially in the nether, because we are like Satan in the hell ahah, but in the nether to scared other mob, we have to color everything in red), but the cow follow us. When we kill him, we can receive too an head (one chance to have this, is pretty rare), and is not very easy to kill a bull, he have 30 points of Life. When we run in front of him, or being brutal (Kill mob or mob attack us), he want to charge the most closest PNJ or Player after that. When you left click on a bull with a bucket, you get taurine, the taurine results in no longer being hungry for 3 to 5 minutes, it also allows you to give more critical hits to mobs. Be careful, however, when you collect taurine you risk being charged if you are abrupt or if you scare him. Finally : Fire or fireworks scare away the bull.

What do you think about that? :p

(Sorry for my bad English, i'm a French boy with a lot of idea)
Amazing idea!
I love the idea! I also think there should be different types of cows. Also the cows can maybe follow the bull in groups of 2-5?
Make them get angry at red.
Great idea but minecraft animals are usually genderless (the exception might be the ender dragon). But we need more animal variety!

I LOVE THIS IDEA !!, but one thing you should add is untamed bulls that can be ridden but buck this allows players to to rodeos. Also you can lead the bull but it will buck at any moment. Also pls add these features with horses so players can do brink ridding.
Cute pic!
Would they only attack creepers or every mob? I suggest that it attacks creepers and smaller mobs (parrots, siverfish, rabbits, babies)

I feel like this mob could be a good combination of ferrets, weasels, and gophers into one mob.  I think some additional characteristics should be that it attacks rabbits and parrots when untamed.  TheFriendlyPine, I am not sure about babies.  It would be kind of violent for ferrets to be slaughtering baby villagers.  Ferrets should also burrow like silverfish, but should leave a hole on the side of the block as the entrance.  They can enter and exit blocks at random, but have a higher chance of entering a block with a burrow in it.
I think it should have half the health of the player and be really fast!

New idea for what it attacks: 

  • Rabbits
  • Creepers
  • Chickens

Things it shouldnâ€™t attack and why: 

  • Silverfish - those are gross, and they are here to disturb the player, not be onehitted by some ferret. 
  • Parrots - they fly!
  • Babies - too violent (@Bilbo Baggins)! 

P. S. It shouldnâ€™t matter if itâ€™s tamed or not.

@Henrik Mittelholzer

I think it should not attack things if itâ€™s tamed.  It would lead to the accidental destruction of many peopleâ€™s chicken and rabbit farms, because they accidentally let their pet ferret in.

Most creatures wonâ€™t attack creepers, because they would destroy the terrain if they did.  I would not like it if a creeper destroyed my house because I had a pet ferret.  However, I think it would be okay if ferrets behaved like cats in this situation, scaring creepers away instead.

Question: Why should they attack Creepers in the first place? They are small and weak. Even the strong wolves are scared of Creepers. 

But Chickens and Rabbits and Fish! That would be better. 

Also, @Bilbo Baggins, you shouldnâ€™t build a chicken or rabbit (or fish?) farm with a ferret around. I think that it adds some depth into having a ferret. 

Oh, and what if ferrets could fit under a slab, because they are only half a Block tall?
How do you get pictures in your feedback

@HeatedMonster32

You donâ€™t.  It is not possible right now.

PLEASE HAVE FERRETS IN MINECRAFT!! they are adorable, intelligent, curious pets who are really underrepresented and would be a good fit for the universe! They could have a tendency, like dolphins, to "play with" dropped items, but in ferrets case, they would grab them and run off with them! So cute, but naughty!
I think it would be a great idea! They should be able to be tamed, and should be able to hunt rabbits!
This is also a good idea because it is very hard to catch rabits they should be able to play with each other it should be medium speed so you can catch it but it can catch rabits
I have four ferrets so I think this is a great idea ferrets are long haired mammals they were used to hunt rabbits in the olden days

plz add the ferrets in mincraft
yes great idea ferrets are one of my favourite animals and i would love to see them added into one of my favourite games!

I think they would live in deserts, forest and plains since there at relitve are polecat s and should grab your loot when you die since they steal things

i agree they should add ferrets into minecraft :]

Well I don't, so convince me.

Why should there be different colors of slimes? How would they be different from other slimes? Would they have unique drops and spawning mechanics? Would they do the same amount of damage as regular slimes?

First time to sent message here and poor English. I just want to convince MacchuPicchu96 that there are nothing different from usual slimes, just add some functions. Feed slimes and make them colorful and docile, or even become vehicles, they must be very cute!

Or diffenrent colored slimes could have different status effects! ðŸ¤— Like this: 

  • Yellow: Fire Resistance
  • Orange: Apsorption
  • Red: Strength
  • Pink: Regeneration

I agree with different slime colors that have different effects, but not just different slime colors just to have them or to have them as pets.
Drops would be recolor of slime balls. You could make colored slime blocks. This would add more slimey blocks for building.
They should make it so when a slime block (Color1 ) goes near slime block (Color2) they donâ€™t stick, yes I got it from a YouTuber but this would help my red stone and lots of other players to!
Maybe you could craft coloured slime balls into slime blocks, and then different slime colours would not stick to each other, similar to honey blocks, but full blocks
I think there should be light blue too.
Sounds like a good idea but should appear very rarely and considering they are sticky I should bring a random object.
@KoalaKat36912 for potion effect idea light blue could have speed, normal blue could inflict slowness
i just want colored slime blocks, idk why people are asking about what they would do and stuff, just take the new mobs. however, they should have just as many colors as concrete.

Hey I think this is a good idea. Also the idea with the status effects and the other blocks. However, I would like it if 16 colors are given by the game and the slimes give a fixed drop. However, I would add the slime that can be colored after RGB [Hexadecimal: # 1AF93B]. This can make Minecraft Adventures map, server and other things much more interesting!

I believe that they should be the same colors as their biome where they have been spawn.
And I also think that we need the ability to paint them with bubbles with colored water from boilers, and to paint the water in boilers with the help of dyes
I think that if a slime jumps on a dropped blue dye item, it should turn blue, and so on for the other colours. The item would disappear.
I think they shouldn't spawn naturally, just that you could dye them
Or you could dye them with things like blaze powder, spider eye, and other drops to give them effects.
yes and it could be used for multiple types of slime blocks for Redstone.
The frog's animation doesn't transition smoothly between idling in water and swimming. Also, frog eggs won't break when the water beneath them is replaced.
A tadpole's hitbox is too small. It's quite hectic to get in a bucket.
The tadpole's size could be made bigger so it could be caught more easily in a bucket. It's too small.

Tadpoles should be bigger.

Fireflies should be bigger than they were in Minecraft Live.

They both should be the same size as a small slime or an endermite.

I think frogs should be able to camouflage and/or disguise themselves when hiding from predators (snakes, alligators, or crocodiles).

Sometimes, frogs could jump from tree to tree and hang on and/or jump from vine to vine.
I think that frogs shouldn't walk on land, but always hop, like in real life.

I used to be an avid frog and toad keeper as a teenager. Frogs don't actually walk that much but toads certainly do. You can easily identify a toad by its warts, glands and the iconic walk and tiny hops! A frog is smooth and will yeet itself into oblivion with its jumps! However! This is a spot on, perfect model and animation for the common toad (bufo bufo). I love this to bits, good job
The tadpole's hitbox is quite small. But their current size is perfect.

Put the green frogs in rivers and pond, green frogs are smaller. Add a dark green/brown frog for taigias and snowy biomes ,could spawn at taigia rivers. Keep desert frog, but add purple frog that rarely spawns in savannaâ€™s. Please add poison dart frogs that live at the trunks of trees in jungles and lay eggs at the tops of trees in water pools could have poison frogs carry tadpoles on back to move them. I think frogs need more variants. Green cold frogs stand out against the snow, I think brown is better to match wood frogs in taigias and snowy taigias.

Also the different frog variants should spawn in there own biomes too.

I feel like the colors are mixed up in the beta. It would make more sense to me if the green frogs spawned in the swamp, the tan frogs spawned in the desert and the white frogs spawned in the snow biomes. They would seem more camouflaged in the natural habitats, making them more akin to real world frogs hiding from predators.

the frog colors should be switched up. the white (tropical frog) should be for the colder biomes, the green (snowy) frogs should be the default swamp frogs and the orange (default) frog should be for warm biomes, otherwise, i feel the colors are way out of place.
Seria muito bom se criasse um local no jogo para criar os prÃ³prios blocos, blocos personalizados o jogo ia melhorar muito

I like the new cold frogs color, but they are a bit jarring when you put them in the cold biome. Maybe bring back the original cold frog BUT also maybe make the new cold frog color a variation in somewhere more green. For example, lush caves. Since there supposed to interact with dripleaf maybe they could also spawn there every now and then. :)

I am really enjoying the way the mob operates currently. I have a couple of small suggestions but overall I think they look great and create a nice ambience. I wouldn't mind seeing them jump more often then they currently do and a larger hitbox for the tadpoles so that they are easier to collect. I also think it would be interesting to see them eat silverfish and cave spiders as well. My only other suggestion would be to add 2 more colors: a brown variation (I don't know where this one would spawn) and also a brightly colored one with spots in the jungle that will poison the player or any other entity after being attacked.

As instantly iconic as they are (which is why I don't expect them to be changed) I have a few problems with the frog's animations:

- The walking animation is a bit too... fluid? Maybe I'm not used to it yet but the slight tilting/bobbing and the way the legs move one at a time seem off to me. Don't get me wrong, it's really good, and that's the thing, it should be a bit more clunky and choppy, so as to fit with the other animations in the game, maybe take a page from the strider's bobbing and the iron golem's waddling on how to make dynamic walking animations that still have the signature Minecraft "clunkiness".

- As has already been pointed out, frogs in real life don't actually walk that much, they mostly do tiny hops to get around short distances, and larger jumps for larger distances. Walking is more of a toad thing. If you are going to tweak the walking animation, you might consider replacing it entirely with a "hopping" one instead, if not they should at least do it less often and only over short distances, utilizing jumping whenever they want to move long distances.

- The transition between idling in water and swimming could be cleaner.

Overall excellent animations! Just in need of tweaking.

Unrelated to walking: could we have tree frog or poison dart frog variants in jungles? Tropical frogs really don't fit them, though they are fine in deserts and savannas.

Also, fireflies are poisonous to frogs, they shouldn't eat them, maybe add mosquitos instead/alongside as frog food?

This may be unpopular, but I would like to suggest a food source for frogs that everyone can appreciate, mosquitos!  Mosquitos could be a pixel mob much like fireflies, if a player walked to close to a cloud of mosquitos they would begin to take damage and have random nausea or poison effects.  Placing candles would prevent mosquitos from spawning and frogs would help keep the mosquito population under control.

Regarding the new froglight blocks: Ochre, Verdant and Pearlescent, I think it would make more sense for the drop from a frog eating a magma cube to be a small item similar to slimeballs that could then be crafted into a froglight. Why is the drop a block? Blocks are bigger than frogs. Froglights should be crafted from the item that frogs drop when they eat magma cubes.

Frog eggs need a lot longer to hatch than what they have right now.  Its a little to fast so make it a little slower.  I also think we need dyeable frog lights.  But there are rules.

Pearlescent lights are the only lights that can be dyes with cool colors.  (Blue, purple, magenta, lime, green, light blue, cyan.

Verdant lights can only be dyed with grayscale.  (light gray, dark gray, black, white)

Ogre can only be died with warm colors.  (red, orange, yellow)

The restrictions would be in place so that it doesn't defeat the whole purpose of finding all the frogs and bringing them to a magma cube, but also adding in more colors and not making the color drops random.

Here's a detailed feedback for the team!

Regarding the variants & froglights, add an achievement for breeding frogs in different biomes & feeding them magma cubes. These are features that many new players will miss. Achievements for building snow golems will also teach new players.

Tadpoles should also spawn in swamps for variety. Frogs as a food source is also great for survival mode. Give mobs multiple uses!

More light sources are always welcome, but they should try to blend better with builds. Don't make them too contrasted! Fireflies in bottles is a very popular request as a light source. If fireflies are meant to be non-interactable particle effects, then wandering traders can sell these instead, giving them a unique purpose.

We NEED mossy green-ish wood for Mangrove, as there's currently no green slabs & stairs in Minecraft. Adding non-green leaf blocks is also VERY welcome, such as wilted brown leaves & pink cherry blossom leaves. Lastly, give variety to storage blocks like chests. These are all important for builds, and is missing in vanilla Minecraft.

If the Wild Update can match the concept arts, with hazy fog, fungi in logs, pebbles scattered about, more ambient SE in the wild... it's gonna be an excellent update. Solid mud is great, but the liquid mud from Minecraft Earth is very important, they allow easily renewable dirt for mud/clay. There's a problem in Minecraft: most building blocks are difficult to renew, players are forced to use wood & stone for building.

It should have a new variant. The snapshot frog. It would be a strange variant when crossing 2 different types of frogs and at the time of laying the eggs, they will hatch into an ocher-colored tadpole that indicates that it is that type of frog. It would be a good achievement of a strange category for those who want to take the challenge of matching 2 different frogs.

As a (monolingual) English speaker, "verdant", "ochre", and "pearlescent" are super pretty, but I don't think of colors when I hear them. I hadn't even heard of "ochre" previously. I think it makes more sense to name them after the common name of their colors for each language, or after the climate the frog that makes them spawns in.

When a frog eats a slime, it should drop an unlit froglight. And then you can craft a lit froglight using a magma cream. It gives an alternative, semi-automatic option for farming froglights and gives more pretty blocks for builders.

Some other interesting ideas to think about are

  • Giving the unlit froglight a light level of 7 (or another dim light level) to give players more control of light which allows for more moody builds since mobs only spawn at total darkness now
  • Froglights could stop slimes from spawning in slime chunks since light can't prevent slime infestations in big underground bases
  • Frogs could help find slime chunks since there is no official way to find them. You could let a bunch loose on the surface and they will converge at a slime chunk. Or you feed them something and they lead you to a slime chunk like dolphins do with buried treasure.
Please add a gigantic ridable frog that can eat mobs and spit them out again like yoshi from supermario
frog eggs should be 3d like turtle eggs or the dragon egg, they should be models that barely peek out of the water and occupy the water block instead of float over.

Frogs eating slimes more specifically magma cubes should have a drawn-out animation of them chewing the slime/magma before spitting out the drop, i find the way the froglights are now and how they just pop into existence right at the mouth of the frog to be unpolished

I do not like the idea of a frog in a bucket as the tadpoles already have that however i also feel there should be some way to get the new froglights without

1. Killing all the brutes in a treasure bastion and disabling the magmacube spawner so you can make a farm around it.

2. Warping to the nether roof to make a magma cube farm.

or 

3. Spawnproofing a huge area to make a magma cube farm.

Of course i don't care if someone does these and i'm intrigued by the first myself but it will be painful for the average player to drag around a frog on a lead to find magma cubes. let them put the frog in a bucket, preferably dry, and just bring it out after dicing up larger magma cubes.

It would be good if frogs had a limit to eat, they are gluttonous in nature, they can even "eat" other frogs although obviously they cannot, so it would avoid only using a single frog to farm froglights (of course, having to go to the nether to decimate a bation to generate the farm of magma cubes) although it would be good that the frogs being mobs that feed themselves should have another mechanic or physical form when they are full, it would be interesting.

While froglights are interesting I am disappointed the frog types are not really more unique. Another option would be to give unique behaviors to each frog like one can be frozen in a block of ice and thawed out, one has a frog song that attracts other frogs, or a frogs that eat other frogs. These seem like interesting mechanics that could have effects on how players use frogs in their worlds. I am holding onto the hope that frog mechanics will be fleshed out a bit more in future betas.

There are IRL frogs that eat fireflies BTW. If you still won't budge on the fireflies being toxic, I suggest that frogs be bred using Slime Balls. If they eat small slimes, it just makes sense to breed them with Slime Balls.

On the topic of achievements & advancements, these should really be used to teach new players about interesting stuff in Minecraft. Achievements like "star trader" are tedious, pointless, and don't teach anything about the game.

For example, there should be an achievement for putting tadpoles and axolotls on water buckets. Achievements for taming wolves with bones, and cats with fish, should have very clear instructions on how to do it, and should exist in Java version as well. Achievements like making a nether portal should be further clarified, such as needing to use flint & steel. And as mentioned, add achievements for making snow golems and froglights. I've seen too many "blind" Minecraft playthroughs not knowing about these features, as it's too obscure to figure out.

There should be a very rare frog that can eat any mob, or jsut goats. A 1 in a million chance frog.
Es una grandÃ­sima idea!

I'm a biologist and love the frog sounds and animations. Congrats to the devs!

Some science explanations:

  • Crawling =/= toad. There are big, slow frogs that don't hop everywhere IRL. There's a famous nature documentary clip showing an African bullfrog (Pyxicephalus adspersus) protecting its tadpoles and it looks really similar to the chonky Minecraft frogs.
  • White frog = snow frog is a silly idea. Reptiles and amphibians are ectothermic (cold-blooded) and actually tend to be darker further north as it helps them to warm up quickly when they bask. This is well-documented for melanistic (black) morphs of the adder (Vipera berus). The desert frog (based on Chiromantis xerampelina) isn't light for camouflage, it's to reflect the strong sunlight so it doesn't overheat! However, this does make it out-of-place in shady jungles, IMO.
  • Should frogs spawn in cold biomes at all? Maybe not ice spikes, but certainly taiga. The wood frog (Rana sylvatica) lives across Canada and Alaska and can freeze solid without dying because of antifreeze in its blood! The most northerly wild amphibian in the world, Rana amurensis, lives in Siberia. Even the common frog (Rana temporaria) is found as far north as the Arctic Circle. However...all these frogs are brownish. The light/bright green variant does look weird to me in snowy biomes.

I'd keep whitish frog for deserts and savannahs, change jungle frog to orange or green, and make a new darker frog variant for cold biomes so we'd have 4 frog variants total.

Frogs have cutaneous respiration which means they absorb water through their skin to help them keep water in them to breath, in RL if you touch a frog or toad with dry hands it couldn't injure the frog and suffocate them because your pores are absorbing their water. I've been thinking about this for the past few weeks!  We need more colors for our four-legged canines, especially when cats have 11 different colors.  I was thinking of possible colors: white; light gray; black; gray and white; black and brown; yellow/off-white; red-orange and white; and brown, red-orange, and white. (Yes, there are wolves with red-orange and yellowish fur in nature!)

They will spawn in a group of max 4 and they will chase you around. They will not attack but very innocently they will try to pickpocket you. Maybe they can give you some sort of item they own so you lower your guard and think they are of trust. When you turn your back to them they will steal some random item from your inventory. Maybe they prefer certain items and disguard others. This will balance the mechanic as they cannot steal, for example, your tools, armor etc... Maybe they focus on stealing food, precious orbs and things like flowers (because they never saw one underground). When the mischievous little goblins steal they will emit a laughter so you know something is up. Maybe, in a addition on the laughter, a backpack/chest sound so you know it relates to your inventory and go check it. After they steal your Item they will run back with it on their tiny hand to their home. Their home will be a hidden small stone hole with maybe a paint they stole and a chest of loot. To retrieve our items you better chase them around and corner them. If you show your sword when they are cornered they will drop whatever they stole. If you kill them they will not drop nothing so its not encouraged to rampage on the little fella. The spawn rates need to be quite rare so you are not consistently getting stole. I think piranhas should only spawn in rivers, since in real life you don't find them in oceans. They should be in rivers in savannahs, jungles, and deserts, since they are usually found in warm places. That way, it wouldn't be dangerous to go in the water all the time.

I think it's a good idea.
However, piranhas are actually timid fish and will not normally attack aggressively.
Usually, they act in groups of about 5 animals.
However, piranhas can see how much damage the mobs and players are doing.
Therefore, if you find a mob and a player with less than half the health, the piranha will immediately attack in a group.
Then, by defeating the piranha, you can drop the "raw piranha" and bake it to eat it as a "roasted piranha".
Now that we have the Mangroves, the Piranhas could fit in there easily

I think this is a great Idea and maybe make them so they swim away from any light source like a torch etc, so that the players DO have a chance of warding them off but still have that natural sense of danger!
Fun fact: real piranhas aren't actually hostile to humans. They rarely attack humans unless threatened and attacks are almost never fatal. The media has given people the wrong idea.
